descriptionHTML:
Bible app that comes with Ellen G White Comments among lots more features.
Complete Authorised King James Version. (Offline, No download required).

Enhance your Bible study with so many resources in one app.

Features Include:
- EGW Comments
- Add your own Bible commentary
- Google Drive sync
- Words of Christ in Red
- Bible Colour Maps
- 28 Fundamental Beliefs
- Daily Reading Plans
- Scripture Songs by Abigail Miller
- User Friendly Navigation and Verse Locating
- Dark and Light themes
- Highlight Verses
- Copy or Share Verses
- Create Notes
- Android Wear Support
- Ask Bible questions from the community
- Clean UI and Ad free

NB: This Bible currently only supports English text
Portuguese: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.tinashe.biblia

This Bible works great with this companion app: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=rawcomposition.bibletools.info

For information and updates Join, Like & follow:
Google+ https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/110842560990111757087
Facebook https://www.facebook.com/com.tinashe.bible
Twitter https://twitter.com/biblewithegw
comments: This is my second favorite Bible App, second only to the Logos Bible app. The Comments are powerful and helpful, I would miss having them if I were to use any Bible without them. I still use this app in addition to using Logos because of the comments and the simplicity of copying, highlighting and sharing verses and quotes.
It's wonderful to have the SOP comments on verses.  This addition helps with understanding greatly.
Awesome. Well done. Highlights bookmarks and notes with EGW comments

What a blessing to study your Bible and get more info on a specific verse that might be unclear. You read the Bible and then select the verse you want more information about, or a specific word in that verse. A word that is hard to understand like "fear" in Prov 1:7. It then gives you a direct link to another app by the same developer called Bible Tools with different commentaries and extracts from EGW books and manuscripts. It opens automatically and you can continue reading more about the verse you did not understand before. So now there is no more reason to "fear" the Lord or stay ignorant of Bible truth and depend on others to interpret scripture meaning for you. Don't forget to meditate on Prov 3:5 daily.
It was KJV.  Now it does not seem so, neither can I find where it says so.  OI like yo know what I am readi ng.
